page.title: 18The Supernatural
page.content: There are many stories connecting old buildings in Cranbrook with the supernatural.The best example is the Pest house,built in 1369.It was first used as a hospital for plague victims. Many were buried beneath the cellars. An occupant of the house Robert Newman claims he saw the ghost of Theresa Benenden who lived there in the 16th century.Two brothers William and Edward Deane are also said to have seen ghosts there.Tape recordings have been made of strange noises.Another building where a ghost has been recorded is Broadcloth next to the old studio.A ghost seen by Mrs Davey a teacher at Angley school,is that of a young girl who died when the house was a weavers cottage.The pest house is well known to Cranbrook people,although many appear unsure as to whether stories of ghosts are real or just myths.
